Key Match Events: Sunil Chhetri took his moment in saying farewell to the crowd, with the end of a legendary career and the entire stadium being emotional.
A mini-brawl between Edmund and a Kuwait international with Sultan Alenezi stepping in between the two players. A yellow card was issued.
A brilliant piece of skill from Rahim Ali as he danced past a couple of Kuwait defenders and produced a solid pass inside the box, but the defenders cleared it once again.
A huge chance from India did not bear any fruit as the finish was not great, while Kuwait continued to search for the goal but still no success.
A free-kick curled inside the box from Anirudh Thapa resulted in a blocked shot from Samad and the rebound from Jay Gupta slammed into the side netting.
Jay Gupta received a brilliant ball on the wings and was able to provide a pin-point cross into the box for Samad, but the Kuwait defender did brilliantly well to come up with a block.
A massive reprieve for India! Kuwait found themselves in a brilliant position with Gurpreet in a fix, but the shot was just not good enough.
Pre-Game Insights: India play out a goalless draw against Kuwait in the FIFA World Cup 2026 qualifier match on Thursday at the Salt Lake Stadium, Kolkata.
Sunil Chhetri retired from international football as India played out a goalless draw against Kuwait in their FIFA World Cup 2026 qualifier match in Kolkata.
Chhetri retired as the fourth highest goal-scorer in international football.
Both India and Kuwait had good chances but were unable to convert them.
India remain second in their group and they will now need a win over Qatar in their next match to qualify for the next round.
While all eyes are on Sunil Chhetri as he plays his farewell match, this encounter also holds special importance for head coach Igor Stimac.
A win over Kuwait will take the team into the unchartered territory of being up against the best of Asia in at least 10 matches.
Post-Match Reflections: That is the end of Sunil Chhetri's career and it is an emotional moment for Indian football.
A good match for India but they will need to win their next game against Qatar if they want to qualify for the next round.
Miscellaneous Highlights: A slight lull in the second half as the match started on a frantic manner.
A chaotic start with both teams looking to attack and end-to-end stuff.
